title: Zork: The Great Underground Empire
author: Inspired by the Infocom Classic
intro:
You stand before a white house with a boarded front door.
There is a small mailbox here.

You are about to enter the Great Underground Empire, a realm of treasure,
magic, and deadly puzzles. Many adventurers have entered. Few have returned.

Your quest: explore the vast caverns, collect the Twenty Treasures of Zork,
and survive the many dangers that lurk in the darkness.

It is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten by a grue.

(Unless you bring a light source.)

Welcome to Zork!

rooms.name: West of House
rooms.description:
You are standing in an open field west of a white house, with a boarded
front door. There is a small mailbox here.

rooms.name: North of House
rooms.description:
You are facing the north side of a white house. There is no door here,
and all the windows are boarded up. To the north a narrow path winds
through the trees.

rooms.name: South of House
rooms.description:
You are facing the south side of a white house. There is no door here,
and all the windows are boarded. To the south is a forest.

rooms.name: Behind House
rooms.description:
You are behind the white house. A path leads into the forest to the east.
In one corner of the house there is a small window which is slightly ajar.

rooms.name: Forest Path
rooms.description:
This is a path winding through a dimly lit forest. The path heads north-
south here. One particularly large tree with some low branches stands at
the edge of the path.

rooms.name: Behind House - East Corner
rooms.description:
You are at the east side of the house, behind it. The forest surrounds
this area, and a path leads south into the woods.

rooms.name: Stone Barrow
rooms.description:
You are standing in front of a stone barrow. An ancient burial mound.
Steps lead down into darkness. This seems unwise to enter unarmed.

rooms.name: Up a Tree
rooms.description:
You are about 10 feet above the ground, nestled among some large branches.
The nearest branch above you is above your reach. Below you is the forest path.

rooms.name: Clearing
rooms.description:
You are in a small clearing in the forest. A pile of leaves is here.
The path continues north and south.

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description:
You are in the kitchen of the white house. A table seems to have been
used recently for the preparation of food. A passage leads to the west
and a dark staircase can be seen leading upward. A chimney leads down.
On the table is an elongated brown sack, smelling of hot peppers.

rooms.name: Living Room
rooms.description:
You are in the living room. There is a doorway to the east, a wooden
door with strange gothic lettering to the west (which appears to be nailed
shut), a trophy case, and a large oriental rug in the center of the room.

rooms.name: Cellar
rooms.description:
You are in a dark and damp cellar with a narrow passageway leading
north, and a crawlway to the south. On the west is the bottom of a steep
metal ramp which is unclimbable. The trap door is closed.

rooms.name: Troll Room
rooms.description:
This is a small room with passages off in all directions. A NASTY-looking
TROLL blocks the eastern passage, guarding a bridge. The troll is armed
with a wicked-looking axe and doesn't look friendly.

rooms.name: East-West Passage
rooms.description:
This is a narrow east-west passageway. There is a narrow stairway leading
down at the north end of the room.

rooms.name: Attic
rooms.description:
This is the attic. The only exit is a stairway leading down. A large
coil of rope is lying in the corner.

rooms.name: East of Chasm
rooms.description:
You are on the east edge of a chasm, the bottom of which cannot be seen.
The east/west path you are on continues past the chasm. A wooden plank
lies nearby, suitable for crossing the chasm.

rooms.name: Maze of Twisty Little Passages
rooms.description:
You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
A faint sound of water can be heard to the north.

rooms.name: Round Room
rooms.description:
This is a circular stone room with passages in all directions. Several
strange markings are on the walls, written in what appears to be blood.

rooms.name: Chasm
rooms.description:
You have come to a deep chasm. A narrow bridge spans the chasm,
swaying ominously. Below, you can hear the sound of rushing water.

rooms.name: Temple
rooms.description:
This is the north end of a large temple. On the east wall is an ancient
inscription, probably a prayer in a long-forgotten language. The hall
extends to the south.

rooms.name: Gallery
rooms.description:
This is an art gallery. Most of the paintings have been stolen by
vandals with exceptional taste. The vandals left behind a valuable
painting of unparalleled beauty.

rooms.name: Reservoir
rooms.description:
You are in a reservoir. A large lake fills this cavern. At the
southern end is a dam. There is a small hole in the rocks to the east.

rooms.name: Loud Room
rooms.description:
This is a large room with a ceiling which cannot be detected from the
ground. The acoustics of the room are such that loud noises echo and
reverberate throughout the room. A single piece of metal lies on the floor.

rooms.name: Deep Ravine
rooms.description:
You are on the south edge of a deep ravine. Passages exit to the east
and west. You can hear the sound of water far below.

rooms.name: Damp Cave
rooms.description:
This is a damp cave whose exit is to the east. A recent cave-in has
blocked off the west passage. Some valuable items might be buried in the rubble.

rooms.name: Treasure Room
rooms.description:
This is the treasure room of the dungeon. Along the walls are chests,
crates, and boxes of all sizes. Most are empty, but some contain ancient
artifacts and treasures. This is what you came for!

rooms.name: Egyptian Room
rooms.description:
This is a room that appears to be a temple from ancient Egypt. Stone
columns support a painted ceiling. Hieroglyphics cover every surface.
A sarcophagus stands in the center.

rooms.name: Stream
rooms.description:
You are on a small beach at the edge of a stream. The stream is flowing
rapidly and appears to be a good place to launch a boat.

rooms.name: Dome Room
rooms.description:
You are in a magnificent dome room. The ceiling is painted with scenes
from the creation of the Great Underground Empire. A torch holder
is on one wall. Passages lead in multiple directions.

rooms.name: Torch Room
rooms.description:
This is a large room with a prominent doorway leading to a down staircase.
Above you is a large dome painted with scenes depicting elvish heros in battle.

rooms.name: Temple Altar
rooms.description:
You are at the altar of an ancient temple. Offerings to forgotten gods
lie scattered about. A jeweled golden chalice rests on the altar.

rooms.name: Entrance to Hades
rooms.description:
You are outside a large gateway, on top of a steep path leading up.
The gateway is sealed by a massive wooden door with bronze hinges.
Beyond the door, you can hear the moans of tortured souls.

rooms.name: Land of the Living Dead
rooms.description:
You have entered the Land of the Living Dead. Spirits float past,
ignoring your presence. This is not a place for the living.
Proceed with extreme caution. An exit is north.

items.name: mailbox
items.description: A small mailbox. There is a leaflet inside.

items.name: leaflet
items.description: WELCOME TO ZORK! Instructions: 'Take the objects you need. Solve the puzzles. Don't get eaten by a grue.'

items.name: brass lantern
items.description: A battery-powered brass lantern. Essential for exploring dark places. Without it, grues will eat you.

items.name: rope
items.description: A sturdy coil of rope. About fifty feet long. Useful for climbing.

items.name: sword
items.description: An elvish sword of great antiquity. It glows with a faint blue light when enemies are near.

items.name: sack of peppers
items.description: A cloth sack containing hot peppers. The smell is overpowering.

items.name: trophy case
items.description: A large trophy case. This is where you should place your treasures. Each treasure placed here increases your score.

items.name: painting
items.description: A beautiful painting of unparalleled beauty. One of the Twenty Treasures of Zork.

items.name: jeweled egg
items.description: A large jewel-encrusted egg. A priceless Faberg√©-style artifact. One of the Twenty Treasures.

items.name: platinum bar
items.description: A heavy bar of pure platinum. Stamped with the seal of the Great Underground Empire.

items.name: jade figurine
items.description: An exquisite jade figurine of a ancient deity. One of the Twenty Treasures.

items.name: jeweled scarab
items.description: A golden scarab encrusted with precious gems. From ancient Egypt. A treasure.

items.name: golden chalice
items.description: A magnificent golden chalice set with diamonds and rubies. One of the treasures.

monsters.name: Troll
monsters.description: A nasty troll blocks your path, brandishing a bloody axe. 'None shall pass!' he roars.

monsters.name: Grue
monsters.description: It is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten by a grue. (The grue is a sinister, lurking presence in the dark places of the earth. It is invisible in darkness and only attacks those without light.)

monsters.name: Thief
monsters.description: A shadowy figure lurks here - the notorious Dungeon Thief. He steals treasures and vanishes into the maze.

quests.name: The Twenty Treasures
quests.description: Collect the Twenty Treasures of Zork and place them in the trophy case.

quests.name: Defeat the Troll
quests.description: Get past the troll guarding the bridge.

quests.name: Navigate the Maze
quests.description: Find your way through the maze of twisty passages.

notes: Based on the original Zork (1977-1979) by MIT students
Published commercially by Infocom as Zork I, II, and III
This combines elements from all three games
The grue became one of gaming's most iconic monsters
Original tagline: 'The Great Underground Empire awaits you'
Treasures must be placed in trophy case for points
Dark rooms are deadly without a light source
The troll can be defeated or distracted with treasures
Maze requires mapping skills or dropping items as markers
